describe: El Salvador, the smallest and most densely populated country in Central America, is known for its Pacific Ocean beaches, mountainous landscape, and vibrant culture. It has a rich history influenced by indigenous heritage and Spanish colonialism.

cities.name: üèô San Salvador
cities.geographical_location: Located in the central part of the country, San Salvador is the capital and largest city of El Salvador.
cities.climate: San Salvador has a tropical wet and dry climate, with a distinct wet season from May to October and a dry season from November to April.
cities.famous_cuisine: Pupusas, a traditional Salvadoran dish made of thick corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, beans, or meat.

cities.name: üèô Santa Ana
cities.geographical_location: Situated in the western part of El Salvador, Santa Ana is the second-largest city in the country.
cities.climate: Santa Ana experiences a tropical climate with a wet and dry season, similar to San Salvador.
cities.famous_cuisine: Yuca frita, fried cassava served with curtido and chicharr√≥n.

cities.name: üèù La Libertad
cities.geographical_location: Located on the Pacific coast, La Libertad is known for its beautiful beaches and surf spots.
cities.climate: La Libertad has a tropical savanna climate, with a wet season from May to October and a dry season from November to April.
cities.famous_cuisine: Ceviche, a seafood dish typically made from fresh raw fish cured in citrus juices.
